docs.lead_paragraph: The toughest part of counting calories can be figuring out how many are actually on your plate. But what if your Android or iPhone could do it for you?

headline.main: A New App for Counting Calories

docs.abstract: A smart phone app called PlateMate may soon allow you to snap a picture of your food and quickly get a good estimate of its calorie count.
docs.snippet: A smart phone app called PlateMate may soon allow you to snap a picture of your food and quickly get a good estimate of its calorie count.

headline.main: What Causes Should Philanthropic Groups Finance?

docs.abstract: Which charities and causes should foundations and families give their money to?
docs.snippet: Which charities and causes should foundations and families give their money to?

docs.lead_paragraph: This year's edition of the annual Giving special section includes an article about how the economy has prompted many philanthropic organizations and individuals to reflect on, and sometimes shift, their priorities. What do you think institutions and people should give money to, and why?

headline.main: What Causes Should Philanthropic Groups Finance?

docs.abstract: Which charities and causes should foundations and families give their money to?
docs.snippet: Which charities and causes should foundations and families give their money to?

docs.lead_paragraph: An article on Wednesday about the role of Abbott Laboratories in helping to build a charitable nutrition enterprise in Haiti misstated the United Nations Children's Fund's position on a vitamin-enriched peanut butter, known as Nourimanba, that is used to fight malnutrition. Unicef has not in fact approved Nourimanba. (A proposal to use the product has never been submitted to the organization for consideration.)

docs.lead_paragraph: A proposal to cut back on potatoes and sodium in the federal school lunch program is being met by fierce resistance from agricultural and food service interests.

headline.main: School Lunch Proposals Set Off a Dispute
headline.print_headline: School Lunch Proposals Set Off a Dispute

docs.abstract: Federal proposal to cut back on potatoes and sodium in the federal school lunch program is being met by fierce resistance from agricultural and food service interests.
docs.snippet: A proposal to cut back on potatoes and sodium in the federal school lunch program is being met by fierce resistance from agricultural and food service interests.

docs.lead_paragraph: Abbott Laboratories uses cash and its workers’ expertise to establish a self-sustaining food enterprise.

headline.seo: Making Nutrition a Sustainable Business in Haiti
headline.main: Making Nutrition a Sustainable Business in Haiti
headline.print_headline: Making Nutrition a Sustainable Business in Haiti

docs.abstract: Pharmaceutical company Abbot Laboratories donates the time of dozens of experts in food sciences and engineering, as well as millions of dollars, to building a charitable, self-sustaining enterprise in Haiti that manufactures a nutritional supplement for severely malnourished children.
docs.snippet: Abbott Laboratories uses cash and its workers’ expertise to establish a self-sustaining food enterprise.

byline.contributor: Ben Depp contributed reporting from Haiti.

docs.lead_paragraph: While many Americans have always given generously, many wealthy people and foundations donate to art museums, hospital wings or political causes.

headline.seo: Donors Weigh the Most Worthy Ways to Give to Charities
headline.main: Donors Weigh the Ideals of Meaningful Giving

docs.abstract: Philanthropy and how it is carried out are being questioned more closely as the number of Americans in need grow; charitable giving has increased, but most donations go toward art museums, hospital wings or political causes, not to the ranks of the needy.
docs.snippet: While many Americans have always given generously, many wealthy people and foundations donate to art museums, hospital wings or political causes.

docs.lead_paragraph: While Bengalis mostly use it for sautéeing, Americans usually finish dishes with a trickle of the sharp raw oil.

headline.print_headline: Chefs Are Fanning the Flames for Mustard Oil

docs.abstract: American chefs, hunting for new flavors, have discovered mustard oil, whose heat and sinus clearing vapors are familiar in the Bengal region of eastern India and Bangladesh; recipes featuring oil given.
docs.snippet: While Bengalis mostly use it for sautéeing, Americans usually finish dishes with a trickle of the sharp raw oil.
